adjectives.description: disharmonic (comparative more disharmonic, superlative most disharmonic)

entries.meaning: (Australianist linguistics) Of or relating to a generation that is an odd number of generations distant from a particular person.
examples: A person is 'harmonic' with respect to his own generation and all even-numbered generations counting away from his own, and 'disharmonic' with respect to odd-numbered generations. Thus a man is disharmonic with respect to his father and his son but harmonic with respect to his grandfather and his grandson.
